verses.verse: (Aaron and Miriam Jealous of Moses) (Ex 2.21) While they were at Hazeroth, Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married (for he had indeed married a Cushite woman),
(Num 16.3) and they said, “Has the LORD spoken only through Moses? Has he not spoken through us also?” And the LORD heard it.
(Mt 11.29) Now the man Moses was very humble, more so than anyone else on the face of the earth.
Suddenly the LORD said to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the tent of meeting.” So the three of them came out.
(Num 11.25; 16.19) Then the LORD came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forward.
(Gen 31.10, 11; 46.2; 1 Kings 3.5) And he said, “Hear my words: When there are prophets among you, I the LORD make myself known to them in visions; I speak to them in dreams.
(Ps 105.26; Heb 3.2, 5) Not so with my servant Moses; he is faithful in all my house.
(Ex 33.11, 19; Deut 34.10) With him I speak face to face—clearly, not in riddles, and he beholds the form of the LORD. “Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?”
And the anger of the LORD was kindled against them, and he departed.
(Deut 24.9; 2 Kings 5.27; 15.5) When the cloud went away from over the tent, Miriam’s skin had become diseased, as white as snow. And Aaron turned toward Miriam and saw that she was diseased.
(2 Sam 24.10) Then Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, do not punish us (Heb do not lay sin upon us) for a sin that we have so foolishly committed.
Do not let her be like one stillborn, whose flesh is half consumed when it comes out of its mother’s womb.”
And Moses cried to the LORD, saying, “O God, please heal her.”

(Lev 13.46; Num 5.2, 3) But the LORD said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut out of the camp for seven days, and after that she may be brought in again.”
So Miriam was shut out of the camp for seven days, and the people did not set out on the march until Miriam had been brought in again.
After that the people set out from Hazeroth and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
